soul_identity.description: A consciousness working toward enlightenment across multiple lifetimes

core_flaw.name: Compulsive helping
core_flaw.description: An attachment to being the one who fixes, saves, or guides others
core_flaw.manifestation_pattern: In each life, this manifests as the avatar's particular form of trying to help—sometimes noble, sometimes misguided, always with an underlying attachment to the helper identity

ten_fetters.description: Belief in a permanent, unchanging self
Doubt about the path, the teaching, or one's own capacity
Attachment to rules and rituals as ends in themselves
Fundamental ignorance of the nature of reality

ten_perfections.development_notes: Chandra gives resources but not self—incomplete development
Stoic investigator learns ethical principles through impossible dilemmas
Desert Father practices asceticism; risks spiritual pride
Struggles with individual vs. collective good
Noir detective maintains perseverance despite repeated failure
Learns to overcome anger during persecution
Grapples with doubt and truth; intellectual honesty
Learns cooperation and social bonds; dies before completing lesson
Grapples with attachment to pleasure and beauty

thematic_question.central: Can enlightenment be achieved through helping others, or must the helper-identity itself be released?
secondary: What is the relationship between love and attachment?
Can two beings compete for transcendence, or is competition itself an obstacle?
What persists when the self is illusion?
thematic_question.resolution: The competition was illusory. Silas and Lilith were always two aspects of the same future Buddha—Maitreya. Their apparent opposition was the necessary friction through which that Buddha-to-be developed.

lilith_reference.note: For Lilith's spiritual status and arc, see lilith-arc.json
lilith_reference.relationship_to_silas: Rival bodhisattva; believes only one Buddha per world-system; her opposition unknowingly catalyzes his growth
lilith_reference.arc_type: Fetter intensification (attachment crystallizing), not power progression
lilith_reference.timeline: 8-10 weeks compressed tracking (Chapters 3-21), then 6-12 month gap before Chapter 1
